message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.IT

Reasoning: The paper deals with win-lose games and their analysis, which falls under the category of game theory (cs.GT). The games are played over a binary tree, which involves data structures (cs.DS). The paper also involves probability theory and combinatorics, which are covered under discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The fragility measure introduced in the paper involves counting the number of flips required to change the outcome of the game, which is related to computational complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the paper also involves information theory, as it deals with the probability of the first player winning in a golden game, which is related to entropy and information (cs.IT).
